Couple lose several thousand dollars after ‘botched’ online holiday booking https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ Couple-lose-several-thousand-dollars-after-botched-online-holiday-booking/6N5VC6V6ANF2PCXET4DBWE6RRQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ Couple-lose-several-thousand-dollars-after-botched-online-holiday-booking/6N5VC6V6ANF2PCXET4DBWE6RRQ/ Tracy Neal'There are plenty of last-minute deal seekers who may have chanced upon this availability' Tue, 18 Jun 2024 08:20:04 +0000 A man had more than $6000 deducted from his credit card, even though he believed the online booking hadn't gone through. Tue, 18 Jun 2024 07:44:26 +0000 Prime Minister Christopher Luxon’s international travel plans had to be altered after a minor breakdown on an NZDF Boeing 757 aircraft in Papua New Guinea.

Tue, 18 Jun 2024 07:30:00 +0000 A gambling addict stole more than $500,000 worth of goods from her employer, including thousands of courier bags, pre-paid envelopes and gift cards bought on the pretext that they were for her colleagues. Photo / NZH

Now, her partner Leigh Matthew Frederick Beer is on trial for her alleged murder.
